## Photosynthesis is the basis for most biomass on Earth
<hr>
<br/>

* **<span style="color:blue">CO~2~ + H~2~0 + light ---> Sugars + O~2~</span>**

<br/>

* **Photosynthesis is an energy pathway**
    + 2 linked reactions
    + light-dependent reaction + Calvin cycle

<br/>

* **Everything takes place in the chloroplast**
    + light reaction = thylakoid membranes
    + Calvin cycle = stroma (liquid portion)

<br/>

* **<span style="color:blue">Light reaction - light energy into chemical energy (ATP & NADPH)</span>**
<br/>
* **<span style="color:blue">Calvin cycle - converts CO~2~ into sugars</span>**


<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:570px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:375px" SRC="images/reactions.jpg">

## Calvin cycle occurs in the stroma
<hr>
**<span style="color:darkgreen">Calvin cycle = uses the chemical energy stored by the light-dependent reactions to form sugars</span>**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/calvin3.jpg">

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:575px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/photosynthesis.png">

## Calvin cycle is a 3-step process
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/calvin.jpg">


<div style="float: right; width: 50%;">

* **<span style="color:blue">1. *Fixation*</span>: CO~2~ reacts with 5C molecule (RUBP)**
    + catalyzed by Rubisco enzyme
    + new 6C split into two acids (3C each)

<br/>

* **<span style="color:blue">2. *Reduction*</span>: ATP and NADPH convert 3C acids into 3C sugars**
    + reduction of acids (requires electron carrier)
    + requires energy

<br/>

* **<span style="color:blue">3. *Regeneration*</span>: Some 3C sugars recycled to make RUBP (5C)**
    + one 3C sugar leaves to make carbohydrates/sugars
    + recycling step also needs ATP

 </div>

## Making sugars requires several cycles
<hr>
**<span style="color:darkgreen">Three spins needed to remake RUBP and six spins to make glucose (a 6C molecule) </span>**
<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/calvin2.jpg">

## Rubisco - the enzyme that dominates carbon fixation
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:225px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:425px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/rubisco.jpg">

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **Most abundant enzyme in the world**

<br/>

* **Most CO~2~ converted into biomass is fixed by Rubisco**

<br/>

* **Large molecule : 16 polypeptides : 8 active sites**

</div>

## Rubisco: the slow, clunky and cheating carbon fixer
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

* **Only 3-10 reactions per second**

<br/>

* **20% error rate**
    + gets worse at high temperatures

<br/>
<br/>

* **<span style="color:darkgreen">Photorespiration - Rubisco cheats on CO~2~ with O~2~</span>**
    + Rubisco does have a higher affinity for CO~2~ via natural selection
    + but.... O~2~ is more prevalent in the atmosphere

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:500px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:250px" SRC="images/photorespiration.jpeg">
